TopicTitle: How big is your parts folder?

Articles.Content:
How big is your parts folder? how many parts do you have?

also how big can it get till you experience some sort of crashing?

Mines 1.34 GB and 716 parts, Anything higher than that and I'll get constant crashes, Make it past 800 parts and it'll crash every third launch or so
At the moment mine is 834mb but I just did a reinstall and have a few mods. Before it was like 2gb

Consider Kerbals

Edited June 6, 2013 by dr_jt

Too big and I'm going to do a fresh install and only load the parts I use from mods. For example I only used the big solar panels from the Kosmos Space Station Parts Pack mod so that will be the only part I load from it.

Wow I did same thing with the same mod, only for me it was the crew tunnel and the rcs tanks with radiator.

Wow I did same thing with the same mod, only for me it was the crew tunnel and the rcs tanks with radiator.

practically the same as well with the kosmos pack.

I also just took 4 parts from NovaPunch as well.
2,06 GB.

3.13 GB i think i win lol

with 972 parts

3.13 GB i think i win lol

with 972 parts

What? You don't crash??

I was getting a load of crashes after putting in the new B9 pack in on top of everything else I run with. lyndonguitar I'm in the same boat as you, 800+ parts is bad news. 2nd or 3rd launch == crash.

Pruned a load of things out so now I'm down to 1.8GB 701 parts and things are (mostly) stable. I also tend to bring up the task manager and nuke everything else before KSPing.

You guys with 2GB+ parts, how much RAM do you have? I have 6GB corsair dominator.

I'm really hoping that the parts database improvement will bring some relief from the "out of memory" crashes that plagues those of us running with loads of mods.

I made a rather pondering post the other day which was a total tumbleweed, but I was interested in the fact that it NEVER crashes on the first launch regardless of how many parts you pack in and what you launch. That kinda implies that KSP is not clearing up its memory, resetting persistence makes no difference so I think things are getting left over in memory from each launch and it eventually is bound to collapse. I hope that gets resolved soon, I just love having loads of shiny parts to choose from.
I use stock.

238 parts, 362 MB

I love mods but I try to keep it in control for loading screen's sake
1,47GB with 877 parts. Game loads in about twenty seconds, which I still think is too much.
1.44 GB with 857 parts. Takes a while to load up(30-ish seconds maybe). Crashes aren't all that frequent. Pretty sure I could get by with several more parts, though...
1.17GB and 902 parts... I used to have more but I found that I didn't use a lot of stuff so I pared it down somewhat. The remaining parts all get used at one time or another.

494 parts and 1.19 GB.

Any higher and I get crashes on my second or third flight.

You guys with 2GB+ parts, how much RAM do you have? I have 6GB corsair dominator.

and I have a 8GB ram, core i7-2600k, radeon hd 6870. and it will still crash if I put anything above 1.4 GB
2,240 Parts and 1.41 size :-p I win... I think
I'd say Bout 275 parts with only Telemachus, b9, firespitter, kethane and KSPX installed.

My part folder, bigger than 1.2 gb and lots of parts.

Edit: over 900 parts!

Edited May 12, 2013 by Mach56

I'd say Bout 275 parts with only Telemachus, b9, firespitter, kethane and KSPX installed.

I want kethane I heard about it but; I prefer wait for Squad release their.
693 MB. Around 200 parts. I like fast loading.
333 MB, and that's just with stock parts and mechjeb.
4GB of mods. yeah i think i use a bit too much mods. and thats only in my parts folder, who knows how much is in my plugins or other folders.

433MB, 336 parts (Zip file thingies/folders/whatever.)

Only 3 or 4 mods. One of them is B9 though.

4.3GB,crash on every third launch.Moved to SSD,much much better,almost no crashing.

I have all compatibile mods.
